name: CynderHost Cache
author: CynderHost

sections.description:
This plugin is only compatible with functional sites hosted on CynderHost High Performance.

This plugin will use the CynderHost High Performance API to purge the CDN and local caches automatically when a post is published, updated, or delete, and when a plugin is installed. This will also add a button to the admin interface allowing you to purge the cache manually.

An API key is required for this plugin to work, which you can obtain from the hosting panel for your site under “CDN” as well as the hostname of your hosting server.

Use of this plugin requires acceptance of CynderHost’s terms of service as well as privacy policy
sections.installation:
Install the plugin via WordPress.org or download the zip failure

Upload/activate the Plugin

Go to the settings page titled “CynderHost CDN” and insert your API key & hostname for the site.

  • Updated: Use cron for post deletion purge

  • Fixed: Hotfix for Smart Purge bug causing pages to not be purged on first update

  • Fixed: Repeated API calls on empty comment spam

1.4.1

  • Added: Asynchronous cache purging via WP Cron

  • Fixed: Category and tag pages not purge via SmartPurge on initial post publish

1.1.0

short_description: Provides an easy interface to clear the CynderHost CDN & local cache automatically and manually.
description:

An API key is required for this plugin to work, which you can obtain from the hosting panel for your site under “CDN” as well as the hostname of your hosting server.

Use of this plugin requires acceptance of CynderHost’s terms of service as well as privacy policy
